The unique identifier for the equipment, which should follow the BIC ISO Container Identification Number where possible.

According to ISO 6346, a container identification code consists of a 4-letter prefix and a 7-digit number
(composed of a 3-letter owner code, a category identifier, a serial number, and a check-digit).

If a container does not comply with ISO 6346, it is suggested to follow
[Recommendation #2: Containers with non-ISO identification](https://smdg.org/documents/smdg-recommendations)
from SMDG.

The code specifying the measure unit used for the corresponding unit price for this cost, such as per day, per ton,
per square metre.

The quotation of the relative value of a currency unit against the unit of another currency
in the foreign exchange market applicable to this charge item. The Carrier rate of exchange applicability
is defined based on the local jurisdiction. If not provided, the customer should refer to the ROE available
on the carrier website or the ROE defined by the competent customs authority, as per local practice.
The monetary value of this charge, expressed with a maximum of 2 decimal digits
Currency code as defined by [ISO 4217](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_4217)
Description of the charge
Reference of the invoice towards the consignee for this shipment charge

An indicator of whether a charge is prepaid (PRE) or collect (COL).
When prepaid, the charge is the responsibility of the shipper or the Invoice payer on behalf
of the shipper (if provided). When collect, the charge is the responsibility of the consignee
or the Invoice payer on behalf of the consignee (if provided).

 * `COL` - Collect
 * `PRE` - Prepaid
The quantity of this charge item in units at `unitPrice`
The unit price of this charge item in the `chargeCurrency`, expressed with a maximum of 2 decimal digits
The list of cargo items grouped in this consignment item.
The booking number corresponding to this consignment item

Reference to the commodity object assigned by the carrier in the booking confirmation,
unique within the context of one booking.
The list of customs references applicable to this consignment item.
Ordered list of cargo descriptions precise enough for customs services to be able to identify the goods.
List of HS Codes that apply to this consignment item
The list of national commodity codes applicable to this consignment item.
Ordered list of shipping mark lines printed on the package

The 2 characters for the country code using [ISO 3166-1 alpha-2](https://www.iso.org/obp/ui/#iso:pub:PUB500001:en)

When the country code is required but not applicable, use the code `ZZ`.
The reference type code as defined in the relevant customs jurisdiction.
List of customs reference values

Four-character code supplied by Exis Technologies that assists to remove ambiguities when identifying a variant
within a single UN number or NA number that may occur when two companies exchange DG information:

Character | Valid Characters | Description
:--------:|------------------|------------
1| 0, 1, 2, 3|The packing group. Code 0 indicates there is no packing group
2|0 to 9 and A to Z|A sequence letter for the PSN, or 0 if there were no alternative PSNs
3 and 4|0 to 9 and A to Z|Two sequence letters for other information, for the cases where the variant is required because of different in subrisks, packing instruction etc.
Name and reference number of the competent authority providing the approval

The emergency schedule identified in the IMO EmS Guide â€“ Emergency Response Procedures
for Ships Carrying Dangerous Goods.

Comprises 2 values: 1 for spillage and 1 for fire.

Possible values spillage: S-A to S-Z.

Possible values fire: F-A to F-Z.
Date by when the refrigerated liquid needs to be delivered
Date & time when the container was fumigated.

The hazard class code of the referenced dangerous goods according to the specified regulation.

Examples of possible values are:
 * 1.1A (Substances and articles which have a mass explosion hazard)
 * 1.6N (Extremely insensitive articles which do not have a mass explosion hazard)
 * 2.1 (Flammable gases)
 * 8 (Corrosive substances)

Code for the zone classification of the toxicity of an inhalant

 * `A` - Hazard Zone A (can be assigned to specific gases and liquids)
 * `B` - Hazard Zone B (can be assigned to specific gases and liquids)
 * `C` - Hazard Zone C (can only be assigned to specific gases)
 * `D` - Hazard Zone D (can only be assigned to specific gases)
List of inner packagings contained inside this outer packaging / overpack
Indicates if the cargo require approval from authorities.
Indicates if the cargo is residue.

Indicates if the dangerous goods can be transported as excepted quantity
in accordance with Chapter 3.5 of the IMO IMDG Code.
Indicates if high temperature cargo is being shipped.

Indicates if the dangerous goods can be transported as limited quantity
in accordance with Chapter 3.4 of the IMO IMDG Code.
Indicates whether the goods belong to the classification of Marine Pollutant.

Indicates if a container of hazardous material is at the reportable quantity level.
If true, a report to the relevant authority must be made in case of spill.

Indicates if the cargo has special packaging for the transport, recovery or disposal of damaged, defective,
leaking or nonconforming hazardous materials packages, or hazardous materials that have spilled or leaked.
Indicates if waste is being shipped.

Four-digit number that is assigned to dangerous, hazardous, and harmful substances by the United States
Department of Transportation.
The packing group according to the UN Recommendations on the Transport of Dangerous Goods and IMO IMDG Code.

The proper shipping name for goods under IMDG Code, or the product name for goods under IBC Code and IGC Code,
or the bulk cargo shipping name for goods under IMSBC Code, or the name of oil for goods under Annex I to
the MARPOL Convention.

List of the segregation groups applicable to specific hazardous goods according to the IMO IMDG Code.
(Only applicable to specific hazardous goods.)
Any risk in addition to the class of the referenced dangerous goods according to the IMO IMDG Code.
Any risk in addition to the class of the referenced dangerous goods according to the IMO IMDG Code.

The recognized chemical or biological name or other name currently used for the referenced dangerous goods
as described in chapter 3.1.2.8 of the IMDG Code.

United Nations Dangerous Goods (UNDG) Identifier assigned by the UN Sub-Committee of Experts on the
Transport of Dangerous Goods and shown in the IMO IMDG.

Description: Party contact details
List of codes identifying the party
Constraints: At least one of these attributes is required: 'address', 'identifyingCodes'.

Description: Party name

Code indicating the type of a document party
 * `SHIPPER` - The party by whom or in whose name or on whose behalf a contract of carriage of goods by sea has been concluded with a
carrier, or any person by whom or in whose name, or on whose behalf, the goods are actually delivered to the carrier
in relation to the contract of carriage by sea.

 * `CONSIGNEE` - The party to which goods are consigned.
 * `FIRST_NOTIFY_PARTY` - The first party to be notified of the shipment arrival.
 * `SECOND_NOTIFY_PARTY` - The second party to be notified of the shipment arrival.
 * `OTHER_NOTIFY_PARTY` - Other party to be notified of the shipment arrival.

One of the person types defined by the Union Customs Code art. 5(4)

 * `NATURAL_PERSON` - A person that is an individual living human being

 * `LEGAL_PERSON` - Person (including a human being and public or private organizations) that can perform legal actions,
such as own a property, sue and be sued

 * `ASSOCIATION_OF_PERSONS` - Not a legal person, but recognised under Union or National law as having the capacity to perform legal acts
List of tax or legal references relevant to the party
Base64 representation of the binary document content
Content type of document
Document name
Name of the person to contact during an emergency

Phone number of the emergency contact person.
It MUST be an international phone number as defined in the ITU-T recommendation E.123.
Name of the third party vendor providing emergency support
Contract reference for the emergency support provided by the external third party vendor

The unique identifier for the equipment, which should follow the BIC ISO Container Identification Number where possible.

According to ISO 6346, a container identification code consists of a 4-letter prefix and a 7-digit number
(composed of a 3-letter owner code, a category identifier, a serial number, and a check-digit).

If a container does not comply with ISO 6346, it is suggested to follow
[Recommendation #2: Containers with non-ISO identification](https://smdg.org/documents/smdg-recommendations)
from SMDG.

Unique code for the different equipment size and type used to transport commodities.

The code can refer to one of ISO size type (e.g. 22G1) or ISO type group (e.g. 22GP)
following the [ISO 6346](https://www.iso.org/standard/83558.html) standard.

Description of the conditions under which this free time item applies.
It can include references to the carrier website or individual charges as per service contract/agreement.
The duration expressed in `timeUnit`s for which this free time item applies.

Unique code identifying the equipment size and type used to transport commodities.
The code can refer to either the ISO size type (e.g. 22G1) or the ISO type group (e.g. 22GP)
following the [ISO 6346](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_6346) standard.

The mode of transport, as defined by DCSA, for which the free time object applies
 * `BARGE` - Barge
 * `RAIL` - Rail
 * `TRUCK` - Truck
 * `VESSEL` - Vessel

Code identifying the unit in which free time is expressed
 * `CD` - Calendar days
 * `WD` - Working days
 * `HR` - Hours
 * `DOD` - Day of discharge

Code used to denote the type of free time.
 * `DEM` - Demurrage
 * `DET` - Detention
 * `PDM` - Per Diem
 * `STO` - Storage

 * `ESSD` - EssDOCS

 * `FMC` - Federal Maritime Commission
 * `GSBN` - Global Shipping Business Network
 * `GLEIF` - Global Legal Entity Identifier Foundation
 * `IDT` - ICE Digital Trade

 * `SECR` - Secro
 * `TRGO` - TradeGO
 * `W3C` - World Wide Web Consortium
 * `WAVE` - Wave

Location name

The UN Location code identifying a certain location. The pattern used must be:
* 2 characters for the country code using ISO 3166-1 alpha-2
* 3 characters to code a location within that country (using letters A-Z and numbers from 2-9)

Additional information can be found [here](https://unece.org/trade/cefact/UNLOCODE-Download).

The 2 characters for the country code using [ISO 3166-1 alpha-2](https://www.iso.org/obp/ui/#iso:pub:PUB500001:en)

When the country code is required but not applicable, use the code `ZZ`.

 * SCHEDULE_B ( Schedule B)
 * TARIC (Integrated Tariff of the European Communities)
 * CN (Combined Nomenclature)
 * CUS (Customs Union and Statistics)

If not available, the UNECE Recommendation 21 `packageCode` should be used.
Specifies the number of outer packagings / overpacks associated with this Cargo Item.
[UNECE Recommendation 21](https://unece.org/trade/uncefact/cl-recommendations) package code

Code indicating whether the products, packaging and any other items are made of wood.

 * `NOT_APPLICABLE` - No wood or any other wood product such as packaging and supports are being shipped.

 * `NOT_TREATED_AND_NOT_CERTIFIED` - The wood or wooden materials have not been treated nor fumigated and do not include a certificate.

 * `PROCESSED` - The wood or wooden materials are entirely made of processed wood, such as plywood, particle board,
sliver plates of wood and wood laminate sheets produced using glue, heat, pressure or a combination of these.

 * `TREATED_AND_CERTIFIED` - The wood or wooden materials have been treated and/or fumigated and include a certificate.

One of the reference type codes defined by DCSA. Possible values are:
 * FF (Freight Forwarder's Reference)
 * SI (Shipper's Reference)
 * SPO (Shippers Purchase Order Reference)
 * CPO (Consignees Purchase Order Reference)
 * CR (Customer's Reference)
 * AAO (Consignee's Reference)
 * ECR (Empty container release reference)
 * CSI (Customer shipment ID)
 * BPR (Booking party reference number)
 * BID (Booking Request ID)
 * SAC (Shipping Agency Code)
Reference value
Seal number

 * `CAR` - Carrier

 * `SHI` - Shipper
 * `VET` - Veterinary

The reference type code as defined by the relevant tax and/or legal authority.
The name or title of the tax or legal reference

Lowest temperature at which a chemical can vaporize to form an ignitable mixture in air.
(Only applicable to specific hazardous goods according to the IMO IMDG Code.)
Lowest temperature in which self-accelerating decomposition may occur in a substance
Lowest temperature in which self-accelerating polymerization may occur in a substance

The unit in which all temperature limits are expressed
 * `CEL` - Celsius
 * `FAH` - Fahrenheit

Maximum temperature at which certain substance (such as organic peroxides and self-reactive and related substances)

Temperature at which emergency procedures shall be implemented

The date of departure from the location where the cargo is handed over by the shipper, or his agent,
to the shipping line. This can refer either to the Place of Receipt or the Port of Loading.
The location where the equipment is discharged from the last mother vessel arriving at the destination country.
The expected date of arrival of the shipment at Place of Delivery.
The expected date of arrival of the vessel at the Port of Discharge.
The location where the equipment is loaded on the first mother vessel arriving at the destination country.

The location where the cargo is handed over by the shipping line to the consignee or its agent
and where responsibility of the shipping line ceases.

The location where the cargo is handed over by the shipper, or his agent, to the shipping line.
This indicates the point at which the shipping line takes on responsibility for carriage of the container.
The expected date of arrival of the first mother vessel arriving at the destination country.
The expected date of departure of the first mother vessel arriving at the destination country.
The location where the cargo is discharged from the last sea-going vessel.
The location where the cargo is loaded onto a first sea-going vessel for water transportation.

Indicates whether the container with dangerous goods cargo must exit the port immediately after being discharged,
based on the destination port and country regulations.
Specifies whether the container must be returned to the carrier and cannot be reused by the consignee for export.
Indicates whether the equipment is a reefer container that should be treated as a dry container.
The seal-related information associated with this equipment.
Ordered list of shipping mark lines printed on the package
The identifier of an import voyage. The carrier-specific identifier of the import Voyage.

Code representing the destination type of a vessel voyage.

 * `DC` - destination country
 * `POD` - port of destination

A global unique voyage reference for the import Voyage, as per DCSA standard, agreed by VSA partners for the voyage.
 * last 2 digits of the year
 * 2 alphanumeric characters for the sequence number of the voyage
 * 1 character for the initial of the direction/haul (North, East, West, South or Roundtrip).
Vessel flag

The unique reference for a registered vessel, which remains unchanged throughout the entire lifetime of the vessel.
The reference is the International Maritime Organisation (IMO) number,
also sometimes known as the Lloyd's register code.
Vessel name

The unit in which the volume `value` is expressed
 * `FTQ` - Cubic feet
 * `LTR` - Litres
 * `MTQ` - Cubic meters
The volume expressed in the selected `unit`

The unit in which the weight `value` is expressed
 * `GRM` - Grams
 * `KGM` - Kilograms
 * `LBR` - Pounds
 * `ONZ` - Ounce
The weight expressed in the selected `unit`
